messages.content: The NHS has been my life. I started work as a doctor in 1982. For nearly 35 years, I’ve proudly served our NHS. In 2010 I rose to become the Chair of the Royal College of GPs. But I resigned from this position in 2015. It was one of the toughest things I’ve ever had to do, but I couldn’t stay quiet any longer.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats have pledged to increase income tax by a penny for every earner to fund a £6bn-a-year cash injection for the NHS and social care.

mentions.tacticalSituation: At this election, the future of our NHS is in your hands.

issues.health: One of our proudest institutions is being damaged by a desperate quest for privatisation by Theresa May’s Conservatives. Our beloved NHS is at breaking point. This winter saw the worst ever crisis for A&E departments. 1.2 million of our elderly people are not getting the care they need. 15% of operations are cancelled. We cannot let this vandalism go on any longer. That’s why I am campaigning for the Liberal Democrats in this election. The Liberal Democrats are the only party to set out a clear plan to fund the NHS. A penny on income tax for the NHS will ease the pressure on NHS staff and patients until long-term solutions can be found. The future of the NHS is in your hands. Five more years of Theresa May’s Conservatives will give them free reign for more and more cuts. Only a vote for the Lib Dems is a vote for confidence in our NHS. As an NHS doctor, I am fearful of the damage that would be done to the NHS by an all-powerful Conservative government.

community.content: £6billion extra to boost our NHS and social care
